I think @wwoodall may chime in as well, but the issue with checking `/etc/ld.so.conf.d/*` is that that folder doesn't contain a clean list of architecture suffixes. On my machine, `x86_64-linux-gnu.conf` contains the following:
~~~
# Multiarch support
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu
/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu
~~~
So looking at it you can see the pattern; it requires parsing the suffix from a list of absolute library paths, which is doable. However, it would be a monumental pain to try to identify which configuration files in that folder refer to architecture suffixes.
